text: I was throwing nap and a Tuesday I think
it's cuz I eat too much food hey I was
throwing up and a Tuesday hi everyone
why am I doing this Tara here
the Internet's busiest music nerd and
it's time for a review of the new
Slipknot album 0.5 the gray chapter
Slipknot our Des Moines Iowa metal band
known for their numerous members they're
kind of creepy masks and for their
massive popularity in the new metal
movement in the 2000s in my first half
of high school I was a pretty big fan of
this band I caught them live at one
point when I was younger I thought that
their self-titled album was like the
most hardcore [ __ ] on the planet and I
bought Iowa when it first came out - and
I love the hell out of that record as
well but very soon afterwards I kind of
fell out of favor with Slipknot not only
because it seemed like frontman Corey
Taylor was sort of spending a little bit
more time with Stone Sour and I didn't
really care for that band at the time I
just I really hated sort of those dreary
sad alternative metal bands like stained
and in my opinion that's kind of the
direction Stone Sour was going and so it
was not vibing with that it was not my
style I was young and angry and then on
their next record vol 3 I started to
hear that sad sappy stuff begin to leak
into their sound and their style so I
was just I used to really dig their
stuff and and there are some groups from
my teen years that I have gone back and
ivory listened to some of which I've
been able to enjoy more and appreciate
but some groups like Slipknot have
really not aged that well with time in
my opinion because now when I listen to
some of their older stuff I hear just a
lot of cringe-worthy lyrics and lowbrow
anger and very safe alt metal production
and now that I listen to things more
closely and I have a better grasp of
instrumentation and production it's just
very clear how non-essential some of the
Bay
members here are 2 Slipknot's core sound
which is essentially guitars drums and
vocals like many other bands in their
genre but there are some things in
Slipknot's music that I can look back
upon fondly for one I think that their
guitar tone is still pretty gnarly these
days and Corey Taylor is maybe one of
the most ravenous just Mad Men vocalist
of nu metal I think he's a good screamer
I think he's a good singer and though I
may not always enjoy his lyrics there is
a seriously real feeling of anguish and
frustration that comes through in his
performances as a kid I loved Slipknot
for their extremity like I said I
thought their self-titled record was
like the most hardcore [ __ ] ever but
then once I got in hardcore punk and
later into grindcore and some thrash
metal and death metal and some black
metal more recently in doom metal 2 what
made for extreme music was instantly
reframed I had heard harder heavier
faster and mean our music Slipknot no
longer scratches those itches for me
which essentially leaves them standing
on the pretty flimsy leg of songwriting
which I think they used to have a really
strong prominent element of on their
early stuff tracks like wait and bleed
are still pretty decent tracks and I
think they did a really good job of
melding pop hooks with their extreme
aggression on Iowa even better with
songs like heretic if you fought fat
sack jack socks as well as people equal
[ __ ] still today I think that sound
kicks ass and I think Iowa does the best
job of any record in Slipknot's
discography when it comes to just
putting the Slipknot mission statement
out there the fast riffs the pummeling
drums the self-loathing lyrics the
nihilism the hatred of humanity but
since Iowa the band has kind of sweeten
their sound and now that they've done
that and I guess now that I've heard
other things they're not exactly as
menacing as they used to be there are
some songs on this record like scar tast
Rafi great title that get the
fifteen-year-old inside of me clenching
fess and getting into mosh stance there
are some familiar themes on the song of
being sort of an outsider being
misunderstood not taking the world's
crap killing everything that killed you
I was really impressed on this track by
the passage of very warped tremolo
guitars set against some very fast
speedy blast beats it sounded really
twisted
but on this song as well and on a few
other moments too we get some turntable
scratching set up against these new
metal riffs and instantaneously the
album just sounds so tasteless and dated
there are other equally aggressive
tracks but very few of them are actually
as catchy as scart Astra fee or
approaching original violence which i
think is another decent track know when
Slipknot go poppy and catchy which I
know they can do while staying
aggressive the whole time when they go
poppy and catchy they incorporate these
sweet clean voiced ultra melodic hooks
which in their defense wait and bleed is
one of those tracks but that track does
not quite step over the cleanliness line
that a song like the devil and I does
which considering that title there's no
reason for this hook to sound that wimpy
if I wanted this kind of vocal
overacting I would go listen to
disturbed you know you're in a weird
situation where you were thinking of
reasons to listen to disturbed but maybe
in a weird way I would prefer to do that
than listen to a song like kill pop
which it seems like Corey Taylor is
diving into this like self-harming
narrative revolving around this girl in
my opinion Slipknot does not do sad well
they do not do sorrow well I get them on
that aggression level there I feel like
they really know that very well but when
they go sad it just sounds so
melodramatic it sounds so forced
it sounds so corny and though they may
be addressing some serious topics when
they do when they perform a sadder song
rarely does the depression actually
translate through so that completely
rules out many a track on this record
for likeability then as I said earlier
you have a lot of these aggressive
tracks that you know are no longer at
that level of her that I am now sort of
adjusted to I guess and then compiled
that with all the lotion II throw pillow
sweet tea choruses all over this record
and there's just not much here for me
and that's all I can really say I'm
feeling a light too decent for on this
thing transition if you get in this

did you love it did you hate it why what
